scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-52 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-52 is a star with 0.54 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.52 times its radius. It is located 1048.73 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.55 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-52 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-52 system


Kepler-52 b

Kepler-52 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2013-01, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-52 b is 2766.600 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-52 b is 2.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-52 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


Kepler-52 c

Kepler-52 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2013-01, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-52 c is 3310.380 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-52 c is 1.840 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-52 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


Kepler-52 d

Kepler-52 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2014-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-52 d is 4.452 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-52 d is 1.950 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.31, and a semi-major axis of 0.182 astronomical units, Kepler-52 d could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system Kepler-52, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: Kepler-52 - System With 3 Exoplanets
